cards.name: Angel of Mercy
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Aven Cloudchaser
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: Just as each added feather steadies the wing, so does the flock grow stronger with each new member.
cards.name: Aven Flock
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{W}: Aven Flock gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.
cards.name: Ballista Squad
cards.text: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor:
"He spoke with the tongue of Angels; we fought with the strength of lions."
—Handel, infantry soldier
cards.name: Blessed Orator
cards.text: Other creatures you control get +0/+1.

cards.flavor: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."
cards.name: Blinding Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.

cards.flavor:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician
cards.name: Blinking Spirit
cards.text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder
cards.name: Chastise
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.flavor:
"He can split a marshfly in two from halfway across the range."
—Onean sergeant
cards.name: Crossbow Infantry
cards.text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Demystify
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.
cards.name: Foot Soldiers
Gift of Estates
cards.text: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three Plains cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Each victory adds a new verse.
cards.name: Glorious Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.
cards.name: Glory Seeker

cards.flavor:
"The day of Spirits; my soul's calm retreat / Which none disturb!"
—Henry Vaughan, "The Night"
cards.name: Holy Day
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.flavor: Such power protects the body with the strength of the soul.
cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.
cards.name: Honor Guard
cards.text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "This scar? From a zombie's teeth. This scar? From a barbarian's axe. That scar? I don't talk about that one."
cards.name: Infantry Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The hour of your redemption is here. . . . Rally to me. . . . rise and strike. Strike at every favorable opportunity. For your homes and hearths, strike!"
—General Douglas MacArthur,
to the people of the Philippines
cards.name: Inspirit
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Made from its wearer's hopes, the mask ensures that those hopes will be fulfilled.
cards.name: Ivory Mask
cards.text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor:
"There was a wall here. Now it is dust. A tower rose here. Now it is fallen. An army fought here. Now it is dead. A spirit was here. It is all that remains."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet
cards.name: Kami of Old Stone

cards.flavor: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.
cards.name: Leonin Skyhunter
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: It entered the temple with all the pomp and decorum of a rock hitting a goblin's skull.
cards.name: Marble Titan
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.flavor: A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again.
cards.name: Master Decoy
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor: Behind his eyes is the pain of every soldier his hands have healed.
cards.name: Master Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor:
"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer
cards.name: Mending Hands
cards.text: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor: They follow the prophecy to each new prophet, guarding the future from the present.
cards.name: Oracle's Attendants
cards.text: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.

cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.name: Paladin en-Vec
cards.text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

cards.flavor:
"What can a peasant get for free that an emperor can never buy?"
—Dal riddle
cards.name: Peace of Mind
cards.text: {W}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Pegasus Charger
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor:
"My enemy's hatred is his weakness. My enemy's anger is my strength."
—Remin, venerable monk
cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.
cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The knight knelt and prayed, first for the sanctity of his land and second for the strength to repel its invaders.
cards.name: Sacred Ground
cards.text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Over the silver mountains,
Where spring the nectar fountains,
     There will I kiss
     The bowl of bliss;
And drink my everlasting fill. . . ."
—Sir Walter Raleigh, "The Pilgrimage"
cards.name: Sacred Nectar
cards.text: You gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Sanctum Guardian
cards.text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.flavor:
Even the brave are scared by a lion three times: first by its tracks, again by its roar, and one last time face to face.
—Somali proverb
cards.name: Savannah Lions

cards.flavor:
"We are not interested in the possibilities of defeat."
—Queen Victoria
cards.name: Seasoned Marshal
cards.text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.

cards.flavor: When she flies above the good, they consider themselves blessed. When she flies above the wicked, they consider themselves dead.
cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor: "Rise, and I will show you how to run without flagging, fight without raging, and fly without wings."
cards.name: Serra's Blessing
cards.text: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)

cards.name: Skyhunter Prowler
cards.text: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching
cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Story Circle
cards.text:
As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.flavor: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.
cards.name: Suntail Hawk
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may take its course."
cards.name: Tempest of Light
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.
cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb
cards.name: Veteran Cavalier
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor:
"No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave."
—Calvin Coolidge
cards.name: Warrior's Honor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Weathered Wayfarer
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Activate this ability only if an opponent controls more lands than you.

cards.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra
cards.name: Worship
cards.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: Wine and balm for the confessions of the repentant. Razors and irons for the confessions of the unrepentant.
cards.name: Zealous Inquisitor
cards.text: {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zealous Inquisitor this turn is dealt to target creature instead.

cards.flavor: Pray that it doesn't seek the safety of your lungs.
cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: You should see how small the map is.
cards.name: Annex
cards.text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
You control enchanted land.

cards.flavor:
"Sit down and read. Educate yourself for the coming conflicts."
—Mary Harris "Mother" Jones
cards.name: Archivist
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.
cards.name: Aven Fisher
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Fisher dies, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."
cards.name: Aven Windreader
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of his or her library.

cards.flavor:
Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.
cards.name: Azure Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "Though there is little to be learned from your dust and stones, I shall wring them dry nevertheless."
cards.name: Baleful Stare
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.

cards.flavor: The wizard who reads a thousand books is powerful. The wizard who memorizes a thousand books is insane.
cards.name: Battle of Wits
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 200 or more cards in your library, you win the game.

cards.flavor:
"Returne from whence ye came. . . ."
—Edmund Spenser, The Faerie Queene
cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

cards.name: Confiscate
cards.text:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.

cards.flavor: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."
cards.name: Counsel of the Soratami
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Cowardice
cards.text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)

cards.flavor:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"
cards.name: Crafty Pathmage
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.
cards.name: Daring Apprentice
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Dehydration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath
cards.name: Dream Prowler
cards.text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.

cards.flavor: Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?
cards.name: Evacuation
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor: Tired doesn't even begin to cover it.
cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

cards.name: Fishliver Oil
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavor:
"Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow."
—Aesop, Fables, trans. Jacobs
cards.name: Fleeting Image
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.flavor: The College of Lat-Nam is often forced to expel students whose experiments grow too risky or too cruel.
cards.name: Fugitive Wizard

cards.flavor: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.
cards.name: Horned Turtle

cards.flavor: "It followed me home. Can I keep it?"
cards.name: Imaginary Pet
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have a card in hand, return Imaginary Pet to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.
cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.

cards.flavor: His peers derive knowledge from ancient tomes locked within dark spires. He finds knowledge within the solitude of a lifetime spent watching the Quicksilver Sea.
cards.name: Lumengrid Warden

cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.name: Mind Bend
cards.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor:
"There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Illusions"
cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"
cards.name: Plagiarize
cards.text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.

cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

cards.flavor: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."
cards.name: Puppeteer
cards.text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.

cards.flavor: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.
cards.name: Reminisce
cards.text: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.
cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.flavor: "Let's go over this one more time. . . ."
cards.name: Rewind
cards.text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.

cards.name: Sage Aven
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Sage Aven enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.
cards.name: Sea Monster
cards.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.flavor:
"Who's the crazy one now!?"
—Torgle, mountaintop boatmaker
cards.name: Sea's Claim
cards.text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Enchanted land is an Island.

cards.flavor: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.
cards.name: Sift
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

cards.flavor:
"Gambling with mages never is."
—Remin, venerable monk
cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

cards.flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.
cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"
cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

cards.flavor:
"If yesterday was two days ago tomorrow, will the day after tomorrow be today or yesterday?"
—Temporal Manipulation 101 final exam,
Tolarian Academy
cards.name: Temporal Adept
cards.text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.
cards.name: Thieving Magpie
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "There's an assortment to satisfy all your needs: deep, fleeting, dirty, pure, scientific, philosophical, after, and even fore. For a price."
cards.name: Thought Courier
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.
cards.name: Tidal Kraken
cards.text: Tidal Kraken can't be blocked.

cards.flavor:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard
cards.name: Tidings
cards.text: Draw four cards.

cards.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.
cards.name: Trade Routes
cards.text:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: You won't know what you're missing.
cards.name: Traumatize
cards.text: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Wealth means power; the power to subdue, to crush, to exploit, the power to enslave, to outrage, to degrade."
—Emma Goldman, "Anarchism"
cards.name: Treasure Trove
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: It allows those with dangerous weapons to pass. But not those with dangerous thoughts.
cards.name: Wanderguard Sentry
cards.text: When Wanderguard Sentry enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.

cards.flavor:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore, "Oh that I had Wings"
cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "Nature cares not for the knowledge to be gained from its study. Better to bleed it dry, lest its potential be wasted on lizards and leaves."
cards.name: Withering Gaze
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

cards.flavor: In addition to killing peasants, punishing subordinates, and raising an army of nightmares, Braids somehow found time for her favorite hobby: petty extortion.
cards.name: Blackmail
cards.text: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.

cards.flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.
cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.
cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: "Of all I that I have lost, I miss my mind the most."
cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.flavor:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth
cards.name: Consume Spirit
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

cards.name: Contaminated Bond
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"No mockeries now for them; no prayers nor bells, / Nor any voice of mourning save the choirs,— / The shrill, demented choirs of wailing shells."
—Wilfred Owen,
"Anthem for Doomed Youth"
cards.name: Cruel Edict
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor:
"Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say ‘death,'
For exile hath more terror in his look,
Much more than death."
—William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet
cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Pit and the Pendulum"
cards.name: Death Pits of Rath
cards.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: Your entire life passes before its eyes.
cards.name: Deathgazer
cards.text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.flavor: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.
cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek
cards.name: Enfeeblement
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

cards.flavor:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch
cards.name: Execute
cards.text:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Don't fear the darkness. Fear what it hides."
—Remin, venerable monk
cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.
cards.name: Festering Goblin
cards.text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.
cards.name: Final Punishment
cards.text: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to him or her this turn.

cards.flavor: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.
cards.name: Foul Imp
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.

cards.flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.
cards.name: Giant Cockroach

cards.flavor: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.
cards.name: Gluttonous Zombie
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.flavor:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar
cards.name: Grave Pact
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Hell's Caretaker
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."
cards.name: Highway Robber
cards.text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.
cards.name: Hollow Dogs
cards.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Horror of Horrors
cards.text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Regenerate target black creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

cards.flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.
cards.name: Looming Shade
cards.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
cards.name: Lord of the Undead
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"You can run from your pain, but you will tire before it does."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.flavor:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath
cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.
cards.name: Mindslicer
cards.text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards his or her hand.

cards.name: Mortivore
cards.text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

cards.flavor:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching
cards.name: Nantuko Husk
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nekrataal
cards.text:
First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.
cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.flavor:
"Of all the tyrannies on humane kind
The worst is that which persecutes the mind."
—John Dryden,
"The Hind and the Panther"
cards.name: Persecute
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

cards.flavor: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.
cards.name: Phyrexian Arena
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.
cards.name: Phyrexian Gargantua
cards.text: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

cards.flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.
cards.name: Plague Beetle
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—Keld Triumphant
cards.name: Plague Wind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Nothing is sacred to the rats. Everything is simply another meal.
cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar
cards.name: Razortooth Rats
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
cards.name: Scathe Zombies

cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.
cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.flavor: They are incubated by swamp gases and cut their teeth on zombie flesh. Serpent warriors are not to be trifled with.
cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.

cards.flavor: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.
cards.name: Slay
cards.text:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: You are who you eat.
cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.
cards.name: Spineless Thug
cards.text: Spineless Thug can't block.

cards.flavor:
"Rats, rats, rats! Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life."
—Bram Stoker, Dracula
cards.name: Swarm of Rats
cards.text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.

cards.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore
cards.name: Underworld Dreams
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.flavor: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.
cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Yawgmoth Demon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

cards.flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder
cards.name: Zombify
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Just try taking this bull by the horns.
cards.name: Anaba Shaman
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.
cards.name: Anarchist
cards.text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song
cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians

cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.
cards.name: Blood Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

cards.flavor: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.
cards.name: Bloodfire Colossus
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: Bloodfire Colossus deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor: What burns the land, boils the seas.
cards.name: Boiling Seas
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.

cards.flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song
cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.flavor: The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."
cards.name: Enrage
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.name: Flame Wave
cards.text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.
cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.

cards.flavor:
"What's better than smashing things with a rock? A rock that gets up and smashes things for you."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith
cards.name: Flowstone Crusher
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.
cards.name: Flowstone Shambler
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.
cards.name: Flowstone Slide
cards.text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.

cards.name: Form of the Dragon
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Form of the Dragon deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of each end step, your life total becomes 5.
Creatures without flying can't attack you.

cards.flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.
cards.name: Furnace of Rath
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.flavor: They patched the holes, loaded their sharpest rocks, spanked their children one last time, and lurched off into the sunset.
cards.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
cards.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Like a loaded cannon—point and shoot.
cards.name: Goblin Brigand
cards.text: Goblin Brigand attacks each turn if able.

cards.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.
cards.name: Goblin Chariot
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .
cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.flavor: The only thing worse than a goblin is a goblin that knows his way around.
cards.name: Goblin Mountaineer
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.
cards.name: Goblin Piker

cards.flavor: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."
cards.name: Goblin Sky Raider
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Guerrilla Tactics
cards.text:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.
cards.name: Hill Giant
Karplusan Yeti
cards.text: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

cards.flavor: It puts the "fur" in "fury."
cards.name: Kird Ape
cards.text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"
cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Magnivore
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

cards.flavor: Nothing makes a mogg madder than having to wake up.
cards.name: Mogg Sentry
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.
cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.flavor:
"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog
cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.
cards.name: Panic Attack
cards.text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage
cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Rathi Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.

cards.name: Reflexes
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."
cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.flavor: Every litter of kavu yields one cub that refuses to hunt with the pack.
cards.name: Rogue Kavu
cards.text: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Called "stonefeathers" by many lowlanders, rukhs are thought to descend from a phoenix that sacrificed its flame for a body of stone.
cards.name: Rukh Egg
cards.text: When Rukh Egg dies, put a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Sandstone Warrior
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace, and the brightest thunder-bolt is elicited from the darkest storm."
—Charles Colton
cards.name: Seething Song
cards.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Shard Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Once I saw a goblin shouting at a thunderstorm. He lost the argument pretty quickly."
—Wandering mage
cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.flavor:
"Some say it's better to think before you act. While those people are considering all the options, that's usually when I kill them."
—Dravus, lava mage
cards.name: Sudden Impact
cards.text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

cards.flavor: Goblins' motivational techniques are crude, but effective.
cards.name: Threaten
cards.text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.flavor: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.
cards.name: Thundermare
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.

cards.flavor:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert
cards.name: Viashino Sandstalker
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.
cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Keldon soldiers learn to move faster than the whip.
cards.name: Whip Sergeant
cards.text: {R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack this turn.)

cards.flavor: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.
cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.flavor: If you're smaller than the anaconda, it considers you food. If you're larger than the anaconda, it considers you a lot of food.
cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Ancient Silverback
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor:
"I have seen life's purpose, and now it is my own."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte
cards.name: Biorhythm
cards.text: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures he or she controls.

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.

cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.
cards.name: Craw Wurm

cards.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.
cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.flavor:
"Earth's increase, foison plenty,
Barns and garners never empty:
Vines with clust'ring bunches growing;
Plants with goodly burden bowing."
—William Shakespeare, The Tempest
cards.name: Early Harvest
cards.text: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Helplessly drawn in, the bard's enemies quickly find there's more than song to be found.
cards.name: Elvish Bard
cards.text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.

cards.flavor: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.
cards.name: Elvish Berserker
cards.text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn
cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching
cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."
cards.name: Elvish Warrior

cards.flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.
cards.name: Emperor Crocodile
cards.text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"
cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:
"To examine the causes of life, we must first have recourse to death."
—Mary Shelley, Frankenstein
cards.name: Greater Good
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.

cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.
cards.name: Grizzly Bears

cards.flavor: "Soldiers speak of defending the soil, but they care only for their nations. I care nothing for their nations and everything for the soil."
cards.name: Groundskeeper
cards.text: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
cards.name: Hunted Wumpus
cards.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard
cards.name: Kavu Climber
cards.text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom
cards.name: King Cheetah
cards.text: Flash

cards.flavor: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.
cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.

cards.flavor:
"Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Llanowar Behemoth
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.
cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"
cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.
cards.name: Natural Affinity
cards.text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

cards.flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.
cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.

cards.flavor:
"Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: The rain is driven like nails.
cards.name: Needle Storm
cards.text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.flavor: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.
cards.name: Norwood Ranger

cards.flavor: "My brother, it may now be time to ring the bell and put out the call for aid."
cards.name: Order of the Sacred Bell
Overgrowth
cards.text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.
cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
cards.name: Reclaim
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.
cards.name: River Bear
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Rootbreaker Wurm
cards.text: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
cards.name: Rootwalla
cards.text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.
cards.name: Scaled Wurm

cards.flavor:
"Her voice is the wilderness, savage and pure."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte
cards.name: Seedborn Muse
cards.text: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.flavor: The only thing that flies over the Krosan Forest is the wind.
cards.name: Silklash Spider
cards.text:
Reach
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.

cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.
cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.

cards.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.
cards.name: Trained Armodon

cards.flavor: The vines and branches of the jungle canopy are all the wings it needs.
cards.name: Tree Monkey
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.
cards.name: Treetop Bracers
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

cards.flavor: The fruit of this fabled tree takes on the flavor of whatever food you love most.
cards.name: Utopia Tree
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Graceful? Yes. Beautiful? Absolutely. Harmless? Definitely not."
—Fyndhorn elder
cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: She stands as a living symbol of the natural world and an enemy of the forces that threaten it.
cards.name: Viridian Shaman
cards.text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Web
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Krosa's distorted groves bear strange fruit.
cards.name: Weird Harvest
cards.text: Each player may search his or her library for up to X creature cards, reveal those cards, and put them into his or her hand. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.
cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.
cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: It lives mainly on fruit, leaves, and the occasional nose.
cards.name: Zodiac Monkey
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor:
"A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it."
—Nervan, royal jeweler
cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.
cards.name: Angel's Feather
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Though it was built as an instrument of labor, it wasn't long before it became an instrument of war.
cards.name: Beast of Burden
cards.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.

cards.name: Booby Trap
cards.text:
As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, name a card other than a basic land card and choose an opponent.
The chosen player reveals each card he or she draws.
When the chosen player draws the named card, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

cards.flavor: Reinforcements . . . or refreshments?
cards.name: Bottle Gnomes
cards.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.flavor: A blade that has never known sheath, a hilt that has never known hand.
cards.name: Dancing Scimitar
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: It lights up the sky, beckoning enemies only to repel them.
cards.name: Defense Grid
cards.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.

cards.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
cards.name: Demon's Horn
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: "True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well."
cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.
cards.name: Dragon's Claw
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, the Pretender
cards.name: Fellwar Stone
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.
cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

cards.flavor: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life. In ice there is perfect tranquility, perfect order, and the silence of death.
cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.flavor:
"The paradox of jade statues is that their victims never really expect attack, but they are never completely surprised either."
—Kabel, Tolarian archivist
cards.name: Jade Statue
cards.text: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 Golem artifact creature until end of combat. Activate this ability only during combat.

cards.flavor:
"Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
cards.name: Jester's Cap
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Cap: Search target player's library for three cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.
cards.name: Kraken's Eye
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Loxodon Warhammer
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink.
Equip {3}

cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.
cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship
cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme
cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk

cards.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.
cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: The pattern of life can be studied like a book, if you know how to read it.
cards.name: Slate of Ancestry
cards.text: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.

cards.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.

cards.name: Storage Matrix
cards.text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during his or her untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

cards.flavor: The bloom contains no seeds. It's meant only to nourish the forest's inhabitants.
cards.name: Tanglebloom
cards.text: {1}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

cards.flavor: As a beaver's teeth grow unchecked without regular use, so does the golem's armor grow without regular battles.
cards.name: Thran Golem
cards.text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.

cards.flavor: It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.
cards.name: Ur-Golem's Eye
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Vulshok Morningstar
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
cards.name: Wurm's Tooth
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."
cards.name: Eager Cadet

cards.flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.
cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.
cards.name: Coral Eel

cards.flavor:
"Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair."
—Jules Verne, Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea, trans. Lewis
cards.name: Giant Octopus

cards.flavor: "Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."
cards.name: Index
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made that mistake again.
cards.name: Vizzerdrix

cards.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.
cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.

cards.flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.
cards.name: Enormous Baloth

cards.flavor:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage
cards.name: Spined Wurm
